sudomaze.dev |

Mazen Alotaibi

is an M.S. student under the supervision of Prof. Fuxin Li at Deep Machine Vision (DMV) at Oregon State University (OSU). He is interested in Computer Vision, Deep Learning, and Data Science.

    Education

    • Oregon State University [ 9/2020 - Present (6/2022)]
      Corvallis, OR (USA)

      • Major: Artificial Intelligence, Master of Science.

        Computer Science and Related CS Courses: ALGORITHMS AND DATA STRUCTURES (CS 515), THEORY OF COMPUTATION (CS 517), ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (CS 531), INTELLIGENT AGENTS AND DECISION MAKING (CS 533), MACHINE LEARNING (CS 534), DEEP LEARNING (CS 535), PROBABILISTIC GRAPHICAL MODELS (CS 536), COMPUTER VISION I (CS 537), ST/ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE: ST/ DATA VISUALIZATION FOR ML (CS 539), TOPICS IN GRAPHICS AND VISION: ST/ DIGITAL IMAGE PROCESSING (CS 559), Matrix Analysis for SP and ML (ECE 599), and SPECIAL TOPICS: ST/ NONLINEAR OPTIMIZATION (ECE 599).

        Mathematics and Statistics: INTRODUCTION TO MODERN ALGEBRA (MTH 343), MODELS AND METHODS OF APPLIED MATHEMATICS (MTH 520), INTRODUCTION TO DIFFERENTIAL GEOMETRY (MTH 534), FUNCTIONAL ANALYSIS (MTH 614), and THEORY OF STATISTICS (ST 561).

    • Oregon State University [ 9/2015 - 6/2019]
      Corvallis, OR (USA)

      • Major: Computer Science Applied in Artificial Intelligence, Bachelor of Science.

      • Minor: Actuarial Science, Bachelor of Science.

        Computer Science and Related CS Courses: Computer Science I (CS 161), Computer Science II (CS 162), Data Structures (CS 261), Computer Architecture and Assembly Language (CS 271), Web Development (CS 290), Theory of Computation (CS 321), Analysis of Algorithms (CS 325), Artificial Intelligence (CS 331), Databases (CS 340), Operating Systems I (CS 344), Usability Engineering (CS 352), Software Engineering I (CS 361), Software Engineering II (CS 362), Computer Networks (CS 372), Programming Language Fundamentals (CS 381), Social and Ethical Issues in Computer Science (CS 391), Graph Theory with Applications to Computer Science (CS 420), Machine Learning and Data Mining (CS 434), Operating Systems II (CS 444), Senior Software Engineering Project I (CS 461), Senior Software Engineering Project II (CS 462), Senior Software Engineering Project III (CS 463), Parallel Programming (CS 475), Introduction to Electrical and Computer Engineering: Tools (ECE 111), Introduction to Electrical and Computer Engineering: Concepts (ECE 112), Digital Logic Design (ECE 271), Digital Logic Design Laboratory (ECE 272), and Intelligent Robots (ROB 456).

        Mathematics and Statistics: Discrete Mathematics (MTH 231), Differential Calculus (MTH 251), Integral Calculus (MTH 252), Infinite Series and Sequences (MTH 253), Vector Calculus I (MTH 254), Matric and Power Series Methods (MTH 306), Linear Algebra I (MTH 341), Numerical Analysis (MTH 351), Probability (MTH 361), Statistics for Engineers (ST 314), Mathematical Statistics (ST 421), and Applied Stochastic Models (ST 443).

        Others: Microeconomics (ECON 201), First-year Japanese (JPN 111), and Technical Writing (WR 327).

    Experience

    • Computational Data Scientist [ 10/2019 - 6/2020]
      Center for Genome Research and Bio-computing
      Corvallis, OR (USA)

    • Undergraduate Lead GPU Computational Researcher [ 10/2018 - 6/2019]
      Center for Genome Research and Bio-computing
      Corvallis, OR (USA)

      • Worked on Tech Data AI Demo which featured in the IBMThink2019 Conference.

      • Contributed to the development of multiple Deep Learning related projects, including Owl Sounds Classification, Plankton Classification, and Seeds Classification.

      • Assisted fellow undergraduates in understanding the concepts and implementation of machine learning and deep learning systems.

    • Lead Photographer [ Summer 2012]
      Saudi Aramco Summer Program
      Dhahran, Eastern Province (Saudi Arabia)

      • Managed a team of 6 photographers to document summer program events.

      • Hosted and organized multiple teaching photography sessions for more than 70 inspired photographers.

    Projects

    • Labeling Tool [ 11/2019 - 6/2020]


    • Tech Data AI Demo [ 11/2018 - 6/2019]

      • Developed a website that races multiple hardware by running Deep Learning models developed by the CGRB lab. The project sponsored by Tech Data, IBM, NVIDIA, and OpenPower, and the project featured in IBMThink2019 Conference.

      • Developed the website using Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, NGINX, and Bash.


    • Senior Design Project [ 10/2018 - 6/2019]

      • Developed a computer vision system that detects pedestrians’ faces to obfuscate them in real-time. Then applies a tracking system to understand pedestrian and traffic behavior to increase the safety of the traffic for the City of Portland.

      • Developed the detection system using OpenCV and PyTorch, the traffic system using OpenCV and Keras/TensorFlow, and the web API and application using Flask, Node.js, and MongoDB.


    • Exploring Robot [ 11/2018]

      • Designed an exploration package utilizing the gmapping and nav bundle packages to allow a simulated robot to explore an unknown environment using Python and ROS.

      • Designed an algorithm that generates waypoints to be followed by the robot, and each waypoint is weighted based on Convolutional Filter with some weighted conditions.


    • Image Captioning [ 7/2018 - 8/2018]

      • Built a Convolutional Neural Network-Recurrent Neural Network (CNN-RNN) model to automatically generate captions from images using NumPy, OpenCV, and PyTorch.

      • Trained the Encoder[CNN] for feature extracting and trained the Decoder[Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) cells in RNN] to generate captions.


    • Facial Keypoint Detection [ 6/2018 - 7/2018]

      • Built a CNN model to predict Facial Keypoints using NumPy, OpenCV, and PyTorch.

      • Trained the CNN model to detect faces and predicts 68 distinguishing keypoints on that face.


    • Self-Driving RC Car [ 5/2018 - 8/2018]

      • Wrote a web app that streams a live-feed and a controller to control an RC Car's controller, Raspberry PI, using Node.js, JavaScript, and Python.

      • Built the structure of the intelligent agent and machine learning model.


    • Image Classification [ 5/2018]

      • Wrote a Multiple Layer Perceptron (MLP) that classifies images using NumPy and PyTorch.

      • Trained the MLP model using CIFAR-10 dataset.


    • Aces Up Game [ 11/2017 - 12/2017]

      • Wrote a web app with a team using Java Ninja framework for back-end, JavaScript for front-end, and Heroku and GitHub to host the web app.

      • Won the Best Web Application for Software Engineering I (CS-361).


    • Personal Website [ 12/2016]

      • Wrote a personal website using Node.js for back-end and JavaScript for front-end.

      • Wrote an NGINX script that directs HTTP requests to HTTPS and maps networks.


    • A.I. for a 2D Grid Game [ 4/2016]

      • Wrote a 2D grid game, Hunt the Wumpus, with a dynamic grid size using C++.

      • Wrote an embedded intelligent agent to solve the game using Probability Distribution Methods.


    Extracurricular Activities

    • IBMThink2019 (Conference) [ 2/2019]
      San Francisco, CA (USA)
      Presenter at Tech Data Booth

      • Invited to IBM Conference by Tech Data to present Tech Data AI Demo to increase sales.

      • Connected with more than 100 potential clients who are interested in using the demo to increase their sales in different regions, such as Brazil, the United Kingdom, and Japan.

    • OSU ML/AI Club [ 5/2017 - 6/2019]
      Corvallis, OR (USA)
      Vice-President

      • Responsibilities are to present the latest literature into AI, ML, DL, and CV areas biweekly, host learning sessions to solve Kaggle competitions for new learners.

      • Worked on building a Self-Driving RC Car, Kaggle Competitions, and a Breast Cancer project with the group members.

    • PyImageConf2018 (Conference) [ 8/2018]
      San Francisco, CA (USA)
      Attendee

      • Attended a conference that focuses on advanced techniques in Computer Vision and Deep Learning research and their implementations to solve real-world problems.

      • Built a Faster Regional-Convolution Neural Networks (Faster R-CNN) from scratch to classify images with higher accuracy than popular networks using NumPy and PyTorch.

    • DesertHacks (Hackathon) [ 2/2017]
      Phoenix, AZ (USA)
      Participant

      • Worked with a team to build a web application that analyzes users' behavior from a list of previous behaviors based on Markov Chain Methods. The app was built using Node.js and Flask for back-end, JavaScript for front-end, Python for data analysis, and SQL for data saving and pulling.

      • Hosted the web application on Amazon Web-Services (AWS).

    • OSU App Club [ 9/2016 - 11/2017]
      Corvallis, OR (USA)
      Active Member

      • Worked to build small projects using new tools with club members.

      • Helped new members in explaining web development technologies and standard practices in development.
